main_definition: In everyday language, 'tabs' primarily refers to bookmarks or indicators used in various contexts such as document editing, social media platforms, food consumption, and personal relationships.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Bookmark for a webpage or document
meanings_and_examples.example: I saved the page I was reading by adding tabs at both ends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of measurement in food, equivalent to one-fifth of an ounce
meanings_and_examples.example: The recipe calls for four and a half tabs of butter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Friends with whom one has regular contact or social engagements
meanings_and_examples.example: She's really close to her tab friends from college.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in bar and restaurant settings, referring to the number of drinks served for free
meanings_and_examples.example: The bartender gave us two tabs on our first visit to the bar.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Tabbed interfaces in software or websites where users can switch between different sections or documents easily
meanings_and_examples.example: I prefer using web applications with tabbed browsing for better organization and navigation.
